description: From scientific Latin Echinacea, from Ancient Greek ἐχῖνος (ekhînos, “hedgehog”) (because of the soft "spines" in the centre of the flower)  +‎ -acea.

entries.meaning: (countable) Any of several plants, of genus Echinacea, having pinkish-purple flowers.
(uncountable) A herbal medicine extracted from the roots and seeds of such plants.
